page.title: 02FARMING:crops - S of Waltham
page.content: Barley is the main crop in the area. It is harvested by combine-harvesters in late June to July. After the crop has been gathered in ,the stalks, better know as straw, are baled. The traditional rectangular bales are now being replaced by much larger round bales. The new form of bale, although it cannot be handled by hand, is more more convenient for transporting by the large and powerful modern farm equipment. They are however more difficult to stack and tend to be stored in long and low rows along field boundaries. Rectangular bales can be stacked and packed together tightly, for example in barns. When straw is not required it is burnt in the fields; this practice is however becoming less acceptable and uses for surplus straw are being sought, for example as a fuel.
